title: external packages for virtual dependencies (blas/mpi)
body:
The documentation of external packages has an example

```
packages:
   openmpi:
      paths:
         openmpi@1.4.3%gcc@4.4.7=chaos_5_x86_64_ib: /opt/openmpi-1.4.3
```

For the life of mine I could not make it work to set up system's blas/lapack and avoid Spack trying to install `openblas` as a dependency for `hypre`. I tried something along these lines

```
packages:
  blas:
    paths:
      blas: <system>
    buildable: False
  lapack:
    paths:
      lapack: <system>
    buildable: False
```

which would be my naïve interpretation of the documentation.

~~Btw, the `hypre`'s blas-related configure is not correct as it assumes blas-lapack names as `blas` and `lapack`~~

```
configure_args = [
                "--prefix=%s" % prefix,
                "--with-lapack-libs=lapack",
                "--with-lapack-lib-dirs=%s/lib" % lapack_dir,
                "--with-blas-libs=blas",
                "--with-blas-lib-dirs=%s/lib" % blas_dir]
```

~~which is certainly not the case for `openblas`.~~
I see that you symlink `libbas` and `liblapack` when installing openblas. However, this is not a flexible enough solution for things like MKL.  It goes back to the issue https://github.com/LLNL/spack/issues/234 .
